titleproper.value: Guide to the Max M. Kampelman Research Files on Communist Influence in the Labor Movement <num>TAM 310</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-05-14T20:18:01</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Max M. Kampelman Research Files on Communist Influence in the Labor Movement

abstract.value: Max M. Kampelman, lawyer, diplomat, and educator, wrote <emph render="italic">The Communist Party vs. The C.I.O: A Study in Power Politics</emph>(1957). Contains clippings, reports, typescripts and notes on Communist influence in the labor movement, with emphasis on New York State, and includes a typescript, <emph render="italic">Sidney Hillman and the Communists..</emph>(45 pp.)

p.value: Identification of item, date; Max M. Kampelman Research Files on Communist Influence in Labor Movements; TAM 310; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
This collection was separated from the Tamiment Library Manuscript Files Collection. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.215.

<list><item>The preceding biography appears on the website of the law firm of Fried, Frank, Harris, Shriver & Jacobson LLP, where, as of April, 2004, Kampelman, was "of counsel." http://www.friedfrank.com/</item></list>

Contains clippings, reports, typescripts and notes on Communist influence in the labor movement, with emphasis on New York State. Notable items include <emph render="italic">Sidney Hillman and the Communists</emph>(typescript, 45 pp.), <emph render="italic">Report on the NYC Municipal Elections</emph>by Bella Dodd (apparently an FBI transcript of a report at a meeting of the leadership of CPUSA District 2), and <emph render="italic">Saul Mills and the NYC CIO Council</emph>(ts., 3 pp.). Labor unions discussed include the International Fur and Leather Workers Union of the United States and Canada, and the Transport Workers Union of America. Local 100.

subject.value: Labor unions and communism |z New York (State)

corpname.value: Transport Workers Union of America. Local 100
